line.words: Eines Tages bekommt Peter eine Einladung. Eine Einladung zu einem Fest. Aber es ist kein Fest von seinen Freunden. Sie kommt von einem Clown.

subtitle.line: One day Peter gets an invitation. An invitation to a party. But it isn’t one of his friend’s parties. It is from a clown!
One day Peter gets an invitation. An invitation to a party. But it isn’t one of his friend’s parties. It is from a clown!
En dag får Peter en invitation. En invitation til fest.Men det er ikke fest hos en af hans venner.Det er fra en klovn!
Op een dag krijgt Peter een uitnodiging. Een uitnodiging voor een feestje. Maar het is niet een feestje van een van zijn vrienden. Het is van een clown!
One day Peter gets an invitation. An invitation to a party. But it isn’t one of his friend’s parties. It is from a clown!

line.words: “Ich liebe Parties! Ich liebe auch Party-Spiele! Aber wer ist der Clown?”

subtitle.line: ‘I love parties! I like party games too! But who is this clown?’
‘I love parties! I like party games too! But who is this clown?’
“Jeg elsker fester!” ”Jeg elsker også festlege!” ”Men hvem er den klovn?”
‘Ik ben gek op feestjes!’ ‘Ik hou ook van de spelletjes op feestjes!’ ‘Maar wie is die clown?’
‘I love parties! I like party games too! But who is this clown?’

line.words: Peter fragte seine Freunde, “Wer ist der Clown?” Aber keiner weiss es.

subtitle.line: Peter asked his friends, ‘Who is the clown?’But no-one knows.
Peter asked his friends, ‘Who is the clown?’ But no-one knows.
Peter spurgte sine venner: “Hvem er klovnen?”. Men ingen vidste det.
Peter vroeg het aan zijn vrienden, ‘wie is de clown?’ maar niemand wist het.
Peter asked his friends, ‘Who is the clown?’But no-one knows.

line.words: Es ist eine Kostümfest. Peter beschliesst als furchterregender Krieger zu gehen. Er bemalt sein Gesicht. Er sieht sehr stark und furchteinflößend aus!

subtitle.line: It is a fancy dress party. Peter decides to go as a fearsome warrior. He paints his face. He looks very strong and terrifying!
It is a fancy dress party. Peter decides to go as a fearsome warrior. He paints his face. He looks very strong and terrifying!
Det er udklædningsfest. Peter beslutter sig for at være en frygtindgydende kriger. Han maler sit ansigt. Han ser meget stærk og skræmmende ud!
Het is een verkleedfeestje. Jack gaat als angstaanjagende krijger. Hij beschildert zijn gezicht. Hij ziet er heel sterk en eng uit!
It is a fancy dress party. Peter decides to go as a fearsome warrior. He paints his face. He looks very strong and terrifying!

line.words: Peter kommt zum Fest. Alle seine Freunde sind da. Jeder von seiner Klasse ist da. Und der Clown ist da.

subtitle.line: Peter arrives at the party. All of his friends are there. Everybody from his class are there. And the clown is there.
Peter arrives at the party. All of his friends are there. Everybody from his class are there. And the clown is there.
Peter kommer til festen. Alle hans venner er der. Alle fra hans klasse er der. Og klovnen er der.
Peter komt aan op het feestje. Al zijn vrienden zijn er. Al zijn klasgenoten zijn er. En de clown is er.
Peter arrives at the party. All of his friends are there. Everybody from his class are there. And the clown is there.

line.words: “Hallo!” sagt der Clown. “Mein Name ist Carlos Clown. Heute werde ich 8 Jahre alt und das ist eine Party, die ihr nie vergessen werdet!”

subtitle.line: ‘Hello!’ says the clown. ‘My name is Carlos clown. Today I am 8 years old, and this is a party that you will never forget!’
‘Hello!’ says the clown. ‘My name is Carlos clown. Today I am 8 years old, and this is a party that you will never forget!’
“Hej alle sammen”, siger klovnen. ”Jeg hedder Carlos klovn. I dag fylder jeg 8 år, og det her bliver en fest, I aldrig glemmer!”
‘Hoi allemaal!’ zegt de clown. ‘Ik heet Karel de clown. Vandaag ben ik 8 jaar oud, en dit feestje zullen jullie nooit vergeten!’
‘Hello!’ says the clown. ‘My name is Carlos clown. Today I am 8 years old, and this is a party that you will never forget!’

line.words: Peter fühlt sich unwohl. §Irgendet was stimmt mit dem Clown nicht,§ sagt er zu Amy. Aber Amy spielt mit den Ballons.

subtitle.line: Peter feels uneasy. ‘Something is not right about this clown,’ he says to Amy. But Amy is playing with the balloons.
Peter feels uneasy. ‘Something is not right about this clown,’ he says to Amy. But Amy is playing with the balloons.
Peter føler sig utilpas. ”Der er noget forkert med den klovn”, siger han til Amy. Men Amy leger med ballonerne.
Peter voelt zich niet op zijn gemak. ‘Er is iets mis met die clown’ zegt hij tegen Anne. Maar Anne is druk aan het spelen met de ballonnen.
Peter feels uneasy. ‘Something is not right about this clown,’ he says to Amy. But Amy is playing with the balloons.

line.words: Peter geht in den Garten. Da gibt es eine Hüpfburg. Jeder hat Spaß. “Vielleicht ist doch alles in Ordnung,” denkt Peter.

subtitle.line: Peter goes into the garden. There is a bouncy castle. Everyone is having fun. ‘Maybe everything is fine,’ thinks Peter.
Peter goes into the garden. There is a bouncy castle. Everyone is having fun. ‘Maybe everything is fine,’ thinks Peter.
Peter går ud I haven. Der er en hoppeborg. Alle morer sig. ”Måske er det hele, som det skal være”, tænker Peter.
Peter loopt naar de tuin. Daar is een springkussen. Iedereen heeft het naar zijn zin. ‘Misschien is er toch niets aan de hand’ denkt Peter.
Peter goes into the garden. There is a bouncy castle. Everyone is having fun. ‘Maybe everything is fine,’ thinks Peter.

line.words: Aber dann beginnen die Spiele. Zuerst spielen sie “Reise nach Jerusalem”. Jane gewinnt. Dann spielen sie “Pass the Parcel” John gewinnt. Alles scheint in Ordnung bis sie “Musical Statues” spielen.

subtitle.line: But then the games start. First they play musical chairs. Jane wins. Then they play pass the parcel. John wins. Everything seems fine until they play musical statues.
But then the games start. First they play musical chairs. Jane wins. Then they play pass the parcel. John wins. Everything seems fine until they play musical statues.
Men så starter legene. Først leger de stoleleg. Jane vinder. Så leger de pakkeleg. John vinder. Alt går godt, indtil de leger stopdans.
Maar dan begint het spel. Eerst spelen ze stoelendans. Janet wint. Dan geven ze cadeautjes door. Jan wint. Alles gaat goed totdat ze standbeelden op muziek uitbeelden.
But then the games start. First they play musical chairs. Jane wins. Then they play pass the parcel. John wins. Everything seems fine until they play musical statues.

line.words: Während sie spielen bemerkt Peter, dass sich ein Freund nach dem anderen in Stein verwandelt! Er sieht zum Clown. Carlos der Clown lacht gemein.

subtitle.line: As they are playing, Peter notices that one by one, his friends are turning to stone! He looks at the clown. Carlos the clown is laughing nastily.
As they are playing, Peter notices that one by one, his friends are turning to stone! He looks at the clown. Carlos the clown is laughing nastily.
Mens de leger, lægger Peter mærke til, at hans venner bliver til sten en efter en! Han ser på klovnen. Klovnen Carlos griner ondt.
Terwijl ze spelen, merkt Peter dat zijn vrienden één voor één van steen worden! Hij kijkt naar de clown. Karel de clown staat gemeen te lachen.
As they are playing, Peter notices that one by one, his friends are turning to stone! He looks at the clown. Carlos the clown is laughing nastily.

line.words: “Ich werde Eure Vorstellungskraft stehlen, so dass ich die lustigsten Witze erfinden kann!” gackert der Clown.

subtitle.line: ‘I am going to steal your imagination so that I can create the funniest jokes!’ cackles the clown.
‘I am going to steal your imagination so that I can create the funniest jokes!’ cackles the clown.
“Jeg vil stjæle jeres fantasi, så jeg kan lave de sjoveste vittigheder!”, skræpper klovnen.
‘Ik ga jullie fantasieën stelen zodat ik de grappigste grappen kan bedenken!’ schatert de clown.
‘I am going to steal your imagination so that I can create the funniest jokes!’ cackles the clown.

line.words: Glücklicherweise ist Peter als furchterregender Krieger verkleidet. Er fühlt sich dadurch stark. Er brüllt: §Lass sie frei! Lass sie jetzt frei!§

subtitle.line: Lucky that Peter is dressed as a fearsome warrior. It makes him feel brave. It makes him feel strong. He roars: ‘Set them free! Set them free now!’
Lucky that Peter is dressed as a fearsome warrior. It makes him feel brave. It makes him feel strong. He roars: ‘Set them free! Set them free now!’
Det er heldigt, at Peter er klædt ud som en frygtindgydende kriger. Det får ham til at føle sig modig. Det får ham til at føle sig stærk. Han brøler: ”Slip dem fri. Slip dem fri nu!”
Gelukkig is Peter verkleed als angstaanjagende krijger. Hij voelt zich heel dapper. Hij voelt zich sterk. Hij brult ‘LAAT ZE GAAN! LAAT ZE NU GAAN!’
Lucky that Peter is dressed as a fearsome warrior. It makes him feel brave. It makes him feel strong. He roars: ‘Set them free! Set them free now!’

line.words: Peters Freunde verwandeln sich zurück. Der Clown fängt an zu weinen: §Es tut mir leid. Ich wollte einfach nur eine Sache richtig gut machen können, so wie ihr alle.§

subtitle.line: Peter’s friends return to normal. The clown starts to cry. ‘I’m sorry. I just want to be really good at something like you all are.’
Peter’s friends return to normal. The clown starts to cry. ‘I’m sorry. I just want to be really good at something like you all are.’
Peters venner bliver normale igen. Klovnen begynder at græde ”Undskyld. Jeg vil bare så gerne være virkelig god til noget, ligesom I alle sammen er”.
Peters vrienden worden weer normaal. De clown begint te huilen. ‘Het spijt me. Ik wil gewoon ook goed in iets zijn, net als jullie.’
Peter’s friends return to normal. The clown starts to cry. ‘I’m sorry. I just want to be really good at something like you all are.’

line.words: §Ich schwimme gut,§ sagt Amy.

subtitle.line: ‘I swim well,’ says Amy.
‘I swim well,’ says Amy.
“Jeg er god til at svømme”, siger Amy.
‘Ik kan goed zwemmen’ zegt Anne.
‘I swim well,’ says Amy.

line.words: “Ich tanze gut,” sagt Tariq.

subtitle.line: ‘I dance well,’ says Tariq.
‘I dance well,’ says Tariq.
“Jeg er god til at danse”, siger Tariq.
‘Ik kan goed dansen’ zegt Tim.
‘I dance well,’ says Tariq.

line.words: “Ich spiele gut Fussball,” sagt Xavier.

subtitle.line: ‘I play football well,’ says Xavier.
‘I play football well,’ says Xavier.
“Jeg er god til at spille fodbold”, siger Xavier.
‘Ik kan goed voetballen’ zegt Jasper.
‘I play football well,’ says Xavier.

line.words: “Aber Du musst etwas gut können, Clown!” sagt Peter. “Du bist gut darin Feste zu organisieren!”

subtitle.line: ‘But you are good at something, clown!’ says Peter. 'You are great at organising parties!’
‘But you are good at something, clown!’ says Peter. 'You are great at organising parties!’
”Men du er god til noget, klovn!”, siger Peter. Du er rigtig god til at lave fester!”
‘Maar jij bent toch wel ergens goed in, clown!’ zegt Peter. Jij bent goed in feestjes geven!’
‘But you are good at something, clown!’ says Peter. 'You are great at organising parties!’

line.words: “Das ist wahr!” stimmt Amy bei. §Das war das alle beste Fest bis Du uns in Steine verwandelt hast!”

subtitle.line: ‘It is true!’ agrees Amy. 'This was the best party ever – until you turned us to stone!’
‘It is true!’ agrees Amy. 'This was the best party ever – until you turned us to stone!’
”Det er sandt”. Amy er enig. ”Det her var den bedste fest nogensinde – indtil du forvandlede os til sten!”
‘Dat is waar!’ zegt Anne. Dit was het leukste feestje ooit – totdat je ons in steen veranderde!’
‘It is true!’ agrees Amy. 'This was the best party ever – until you turned us to stone!’

line.words: “Ich habe nächste Woche Geburtstag,” sagt Peter. “Magst Du mein Fest organisieren? Bitte?”

subtitle.line: ‘It’s my birthday next week,’ says Peter. ‘Will you organise my party. Please?’
‘It’s my birthday next week,’ says Peter. ‘Will you organise my party. Please?’
“I næste uge har jeg fødselsdag”, siger Peter. ”Vil du ikke nok holde min fest?”
‘Volgende week ben ik jarig’ zegt Peter. ‘Wil jij mijn feestje organiseren? Alsjeblieft?’
‘It’s my birthday next week,’ says Peter. ‘Will you organise my party. Please?’

line.words: “Oh, danke!” sagt der Clown. “Ich würde das sehr gerne machen!”

subtitle.line: ‘Oh, thank you!’ says the clown. ‘I would love to!’
‘Oh, thank you!’ says the clown. ‘I would love to!’
”Tak”, siger klovnen. ”Det vil jeg gerne!”
‘Oh, dank je wel!’ zegt de clown. ‘Heel graag!’
‘Oh, thank you!’ says the clown. ‘I would love to!’

line.words: Und weil er sich nützlich fühlte war er nie wieder gemein. Ende.

subtitle.line: And because the clown felt valuable, he was never mean again. The end.
And because the clown felt valuable, he was never mean again. The end.
Og fordi klovnen følte, at han var noget værd, var han aldrig mere ond. Slut.
En omdat de clown zich belangrijk voelde, was hij nooit meer gemeen. Einde.
And because the clown felt valuable, he was never mean again. The end.
